name: instant noodles
summary: Quick-cook noodles flavored with seasoning packets. A dorm classic for fast, hot meals.
cooking_tips: Crack an egg or stir in hot sauce for a richer meal.

name: microwaveable mac & cheese
summary: Pre-portioned pasta and cheese meals ready in minutes using a microwave.
cooking_tips: Mix in salsa or leftover meats to elevate flavor.

name: chips
summary: Crispy, salty snack foods made from potatoes or corn. Great as sides or toppings.
cooking_tips: Use crushed as a topping on baked dishes.

name: pretzels
summary: Dry, baked bread snacks with a chewy or crispy texture.
cooking_tips: Great for dipping or as a snack with coffee or soda.

name: popcorn
summary: Puffed corn snack often flavored with butter or cheese.
cooking_tips: Add cinnamon sugar or crushed candy for sweet variations.

name: granola bars
summary: Compact bars made from oats, nuts, and sweeteners. Good for energy on the go.
cooking_tips: Crumble into yogurt or microwave briefly for a warm treat.

name: trail mix
summary: Mix of nuts, dried fruit, chocolate, and seeds. High-energy snack.
cooking_tips: Great topping for oatmeal or cold cereal.

name: crackers
summary: Dry, crunchy snacks often served with cheese or dips.
cooking_tips: Stack with deli meat for instant mini sandwiches.

name: cookies
summary: Sweet baked snacks often containing chocolate, cream, or spices.
cooking_tips: Crush into ice cream or microwave for a soft dessert.

name: candy
summary: Sweet treats made from sugar, chocolate, or gelatin.
cooking_tips: Use as toppings for popcorn or microwave desserts.

name: beef jerky
summary: Dried, seasoned meat snack. High in protein and shelf-stable.
cooking_tips: Chop into pieces and toss into salads or instant noodles.

name: energy drinks
summary: Carbonated drinks with caffeine, vitamins, and sugar for a quick boost.
cooking_tips: Serve chilled. Don’t mix with alcohol or drink in excess.

name: coffee
summary: Brewed beverage from ground coffee beans. A go-to for energy.
cooking_tips: Add flavored creamer, cinnamon, or cocoa powder for variety.

name: tea
summary: Infused beverage made from leaves, herbs, or fruit blends.
cooking_tips: Add milk for chai; steep longer for stronger flavor.

name: soft drinks
summary: Carbonated sodas in various flavors. Often served cold.
cooking_tips: Use in floats or as a sweetener in sauces (e.g. cola BBQ).

name: sports drinks
summary: Hydration beverages with electrolytes, sugar, and flavoring.
cooking_tips: Serve chilled or frozen for a slushy-like treat.

name: juice
summary: Fruit-based beverages, often sweet and tangy. Can be fortified with vitamins.
cooking_tips: Freeze into popsicles or blend into smoothies.

name: milk
summary: Dairy or plant-based beverage used in drinks, cereal, or cooking.
cooking_tips: Use to make oatmeal or creamy sauces.

name: flavored water
summary: Lightly sweetened or naturally flavored water. Great hydration alternative to soda.
cooking_tips: Chill before serving for maximum refreshment.

name: frozen pizza
summary: Pre-made pizza stored in the freezer, heated in microwave or oven.
cooking_tips: Add extra toppings before cooking to level it up.

name: frozen meals
summary: Ready-to-eat meals stored in the freezer. Microwave-friendly.
cooking_tips: Sprinkle herbs or shredded cheese after cooking.

name: canned soup
summary: Shelf-stable soups and stews. Heated in microwave or stovetop.
cooking_tips: Add cooked rice or pasta to stretch into a full meal.

name: canned tuna
summary: Cooked tuna preserved in water or oil. Protein-rich and shelf-stable.
cooking_tips: Use in tuna salad, melt, or stir into instant noodles.

name: peanut butter
summary: Ground peanut spread rich in protein and fats. Works in sweet or savory.
cooking_tips: Microwave with noodles for a quick satay sauce.

name: jelly
summary: Sweet fruit preserve used in sandwiches or desserts.
cooking_tips: Spread on toast or stir into oatmeal for a fruity twist.

name: bread
summary: Staple carb used for sandwiches, toast, or quick pizzas.
cooking_tips: Toast for texture or make grilled cheese sandwiches.

name: bagels
summary: Dense round bread with a chewy texture, ideal for breakfast or sandwiches.
cooking_tips: Toast and top with savory or sweet spreads.

name: tortillas
summary: Flatbreads used for wraps, quesadillas, and more.
cooking_tips: Heat briefly on a pan for better flexibility and flavor.

name: rice
summary: Simple grain base used in meals across many cuisines.
cooking_tips: Microwaveable pouches make prep super fast.

name: cereal
summary: Breakfast grain, usually sweetened and eaten with milk.
cooking_tips: Crush to use as topping for desserts or yogurt.

name: oatmeal
summary: Cooked oats, good for breakfast and heart health. Instant packets are microwaveable.
cooking_tips: Add sliced banana, honey, or trail mix for flavor.

name: mozzarella sticks
summary: Breaded cheese sticks, often microwaved or oven-baked.
cooking_tips: Best when cooked until golden and gooey.

name: chicken nuggets
summary: Breaded chicken pieces, typically frozen and microwave-ready.
cooking_tips: Toast or bake for best texture; pair with dipping sauce.

name: string cheese
summary: Individually packaged cheese sticks that can be pulled apart into strings.
cooking_tips: Eat as-is or melt onto a mini tortilla pizza.

name: salsa
summary: Tomato-based condiment with varying spice levels, used as a dip or topping.
cooking_tips: Mix into mac & cheese or use in wraps for flavor.

name: apples
summary: Crunchy, sweet fruit that stores well and is easy to eat.
cooking_tips: Slice and dip in peanut butter for a balanced snack.

name: bananas
summary: Soft, sweet fruit that’s portable and full of potassium.
cooking_tips: Mash into oatmeal or toast for extra sweetness.

name: greek yogurt
summary: Thick, protein-rich yogurt with a tangy flavor.
cooking_tips: Use in dips or as a mayo substitute.

name: baby carrots
summary: Small, peeled carrots ideal for snacking.
cooking_tips: Eat raw or steam for a quick veggie side.

name: celery sticks
summary: Crisp, hydrating vegetable sticks often used for snacking or dips.
cooking_tips: Great raw, or chopped into soups and stir-fries.

name: hummus
summary: Creamy dip made from chickpeas, tahini, and garlic. High in protein and fiber.
cooking_tips: Use as a spread in wraps or sandwiches.

name: hard-boiled eggs
summary: Eggs boiled in their shell, peeled, and eaten cold or warm.
cooking_tips: Peel and slice onto toast, salad, or ramen.

name: salt
summary: Essential seasoning used to enhance flavor in nearly all dishes.
cooking_tips: Use sparingly; enhances both sweet and savory dishes.

name: pepper
summary: Ground black pepper adds heat and complexity to dishes.
cooking_tips: Add at the end of cooking to preserve flavor.

name: hot sauce
summary: Spicy condiment used to add heat and tang to food.
cooking_tips: A few drops go a long way; try mixing into condiments.

name: sugar
summary: Sweetener used in baking, drinks, and sauces.
cooking_tips: Mix into sauces for balance; sprinkle over cereal or fruit.

name: coffee creamer
summary: Flavored liquid or powder added to coffee for creaminess and sweetness.
cooking_tips: Add to oatmeal or desserts for extra flavor.

name: ketchup
summary: Sweet and tangy tomato-based condiment.
cooking_tips: Mix with mayo or hot sauce for a custom dip.

name: mustard
summary: Zesty, tangy condiment made from mustard seeds.
cooking_tips: Add to salad dressings or sandwich spreads.

name: mayonnaise
summary: Creamy condiment made from eggs and oil, often used as a sandwich spread.
cooking_tips: Use as a base for dips or mix with sriracha for a spicy spread.

name: soy sauce
summary: Salty, umami-rich sauce made from fermented soybeans.
cooking_tips: Use in stir-fries, marinades, or drizzled on rice.

name: sriracha
summary: Spicy chili garlic sauce with a hint of sweetness.
cooking_tips: Great in sauces, mayo, or straight onto food.
